dimensions: H x W x D: 6 x 7.6 x 1.9 cm (2 3/8 in. x 3 in. x 3/4 in.)
title: The Weighing Of The Heart
provenance: 2000, purchased by donor from Kennedy Galleries, New York, NY, at time of the Kennedy Galleries exhibition, Keven Coates: Jewel Works / Fragments: Pages Stolen From A Book Of Time.
medium: Gold, faience (amulet fragment, Egyptian, late period?), turquoise, carnelian, ebony, silver
description: Roughly rectangular form, the ebony and carnelian surface with applied fragment of Egyptian faience figure in center, flanked by gold hart in scale above gold feet on left, jackle's head hoding scale with feather on right; turquoise beads applied along left and right edges, and center top and bottom edges.
name: Brooch
